title: Expert Web Developer Needed: Enhance Font Implementation on Kajabi Platform - Upwork
description: We are searching for a web developer proficient in Kajabi platform customization to assess and make changes to our current custom font implementation. The task involves making crucial adjustments to guarantee consistency and coherence across our Kajabi account. Our primary aim is to seamlessly transition all font styles to default Kajabi fonts, while integrating custom fonts on several designated landing pages. CURRENT STATUS Right now we currently have custom code added within our Kajabi account for Headings, subheadings, and body fonts. Thus, these fonts are applying to ALL assets within our Kajabi site: main website pages (library, login, products, etc.) as well as all landing pages. We only need custom fonts on 11 landing pages and instead we need default fonts on ALL other sites. WHAT WE NEED We need eleven landing pages to have custom fonts — we need the integrity of the existing design w/ these fonts to stay in-tact. These pages SHOULD NOT be changed. If uploading custom code just into these individual pages, that’s fine, but we need them to look the same as before removing the main fonts. We then need the ability to use Kajabi’s DEFAULT fonts on all Website pages and all future landing pages. WHAT WE ENVISION We think this may be as simple as removing the existing code of the custom fonts and then RE-uploading those same exact fonts back in to the three individual websites that need the custom fonts. From there, since the main custom code was removed from our Kajabi site, then we could begin using the default fonts moving forward. SUMBIT ANSWERS TO THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS: 1. Are you clear on the solution we’re seeking? If yes, please briefly summarize below. 2. If removing coded fonts from the website and then into individual landing pages, how confident are you that you can keep the current design of the landing pages that need custom fonts? 3. How quickly can you fix this for us? What additional information will you need from me to complete this?Skills: Kajabi, Website Customization

title: Innovative Developer Needed for WCAG 1.4 Accessibility Compliance Automation in Documents - Upwork
description: Project Description: We are pioneering a project to enhance document accessibility across the board. This segment of the project aims to tackle the WCAG 1.4 Distinguishable guideline, focusing on enhancing document readability and accessibility by improving visual presentation and ensuring content is easily distinguishable for all users, including those with visual impairments. Objectives: Develop an automated system to assess documents against the WCAG 1.4 Distinguishable criteria, ensuring content is easily visible and audible. Create solutions that facilitate the detection of issues related to color usage, contrast ratios, text size, images of text, background audio, and text spacing. Implement features for automated suggestions and remediation to meet or exceed the minimum accessibility standards. Guideline Adaptation: It is important to realize that some of the guideline definitions may need to be modified to make them more applicable to documents if this is necessary, mention what the change is and why it better accommodates documents. Key Features and Deliverables: Automated detection of WCAG 1.4 compliance issues within documents, including insufficient contrast, improper use of color, inadequate text size, and incorrect text spacing. Recommendations for modifications or enhancements to ensure documents meet the WCAG 1.4 guidelines. A reporting tool that outlines detected issues and provides clear suggestions for improvements or corrections. Integration with the broader Accessibility Project system for a cohesive accessibility improvement process. Skills and Experience Required: Expertise in AI/ML technologies, with a focus on image and text analysis. Strong background in accessibility standards, specifically familiarity with WCAG guidelines. Proficiency in handling and manipulating document formats such as DOC, PPT, and PDF. Experience in developing software solutions that improve document accessibility and readability. Milestones: Milestone 1 (Deadline: Two weeks from contract initiation): Develop a software system capable of identifying key WCAG 1.4 compliance issues related to visual and auditory content presentation. Deliverable: A software prototype demonstrating initial detection capabilities. Milestone 2 (Deadline: One week after test case results recived): After initial submission testing of the solution will occur with test cases we have curated. We will return these tests and the results to you to help with refinement. Note this will be an iterative process so the timeline on this milestone is flexible. Deliverable: A software prototype demonstrating moderately accurate detection capabilities. Milestone 3 (Deadline: Will be added after detection is satisfactory): Enhance the system to offer automated remediation suggestions or corrections for identified issues, ensuring documents can be adjusted to comply with WCAG 1.4 guidelines. Deliverable: An enhanced system that generates detailed reports with remediation recommendations for various document types. Budget: Please provide a detailed budget proposal for each milestone, reflecting the complexity of the project and your expertise. Application Requirements: Detailed resume/CV, highlighting relevant projects and experience. Portfolio demonstrating previous work in software development with an emphasis on accessibility. A brief proposal outlining your approach to the project, including any preliminary ideas for tackling the specific challenges associated with WCAG 1.4 Distinguishable guidelines. Evaluation Criteria: Depth of technical expertise and experience with document accessibility challenges. Quality and relevance of portfolio projects, especially those related to accessibility improvements. Clarity and innovativeness of the proposal in addressing WCAG 1.4 challenges. Competitiveness of the budget, considering the scope and impact of the project. Contact Information: Applications, including all required documents, should be submitted on Upwork. Resources: https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/Skills: Python, Web Content Accessibility Guidelines

title:
Java Project on Image Processing
Topic: QuadTree & Circular Queue - Upwork
description: Image Processing Topic: QuadTree & Circular Queue I need it by March 21 from the project description: Where should I start? Its recommended to follow these steps in this specific order: 1. Read the Background section to fully understand what kind of data stuctures you’re called to implement. Do not start coding before you do that! 2. Check to see if you have a tool to view PGM files. Open the provided image1.pgm with your favorite image viewing application. Most applications support the PGM format. If not, download the popular GIMP which is free and opensource. This is not a required step to complete this project but it will help you a lot if you can visualize the images that you use as input / output. 3. Read the “Rules” section to avoid violations that can cost you many points. 4. We recommend you work on the code in the following order: 1. Utilities.loadData – you need to read an image file before you can do anything else 2. class TreeNode – a simple node for the tree; requires minimal work 3. class Queue – it’s a generic queue that doesn’t depend on quadtrees; it’s not hard to implement and you will need it later for the tree traversal anyway 4. QuadTreeImage constructor – it creates the quadtree structure which is the basis for the other tree operations 5. QuadTreeImage.countNodes – it’s a low-hanging fruit and will quickly get you into the tree-traversal mood 6. QuadTreeImage.brightness – it’s a good practice of recursion before you attempt the setColor method 7. QuadTreeImage.getColor – it’s a good practice of recursion before you attempt the setColor method 8. Utilities.exportImage – it’s easy to implement with the use of getColor 9. QuadTreeImage.compareTo – another low-hanging fruit 10. QuadTreeImage.toString – although the level-order traversal is straight forward once you implement the queue, this method has a small challenge; you must figure out how to include some extra data in the returned string 11. The setColor is the most challenging method because it can trigger the restructuring of the quadtree. Work on it after you’re done with everything else. Background A digital image with dimensions HxW is represented with a matrix of pixels that has H rows and W columns. In grayscale images, each pixel is an integer that takes values from 0-255 (i.e. 1 byte). A value of zero corresponds to the black color and a value of 255 corresponds to the white color. Everything in between is a tone of gray; the darker the gray the closer to 0, the lighter the gray the closer to 255. Figure 2a depicts a zoom-in on a 16x12 grayscale image. In Figure 2b you can see the values of each pixel superimposed on the image. And in Figure 2c you can see the matrix representation of this grayscale image. In this project we will not work with color images but everything we discuss here could equally well apply to color images too.Skills: Java
